description: Sen. Kamala Harris reacted to Bob Woodward’s interview with President Trump where he downplayed the coronavirus. Harris said the president, “is an individual who is not concerned about the health, safety and well-being of the American people.”
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Community searches for tiger after multiple sightings in Knoxville, Tenn.
description: A community is searching for a tiger after multiple people spotted the animal in Knoxville, Tennessee. A deputy who saw the large cat said it appeared to be stripped and between 150 to 200 pounds.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Army Ranger who led hostage rescue to receive Medal of Honor
description: Sergeant Major Thomas Payne was part of an elite U.S. Army special ops team sent to free dozens of hostages being held by ISIS in 2015. Payne will receive the Medal of Honor on September 11, nearly two decades after the attacks inspired him to join the Army.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Students speak out about university policies on coronavirus isolation
description: With no nationwide COVID-19 protocol for universities, individual schools are making their own plans for students who test positive. Often that means moving students into isolation dorms as families say schools aren’t doing enough.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Russia, China, and Iran launched cyberattacks on presidential campaigns, Microsoft says
description: The company says Russia, China and Iran have recently targeted both parties, political consultants and people linked to both the Biden and Trump campaigns. Spokespeople for both campaigns tell NBC News they are working against these threats.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Restaurants continue to struggle amid coronavirus pandemic
description: Nationwide, more than 18,000 restaurants that shut down towards the beginning of the pandemic were closed for good by August.
source.name: NBC News

title: Deadly wildfires sweep through West Coast
description: With hundreds of wildfires burning in a number of western states, firefighters say whipping winds and record heat are helping fuel the devastating conditions.
